channel.title: Best Gaming System
channel.description:
Which do you prefer?
PS3 or Xbox360
Thought I'd separate the community.

item.title: Best Gaming System
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:146, topic:264476”][quote author=Gloab_ link=topic=349225.msg2825046#msg2825046 date=1244912258]

There’s more than just the overall to take into account. As a matter of fact, it’s not even right to judge the system’s overall as a way to choose which is better. There are different qualities in each of them. They’re all relative.

PS3 - Quality
Xbox360 - Quantity (Bigger userbase)
Nintendo - Dynamic

If anyone wants to claim that they have factual information on which is better, they’re wrong before they even start making the post. It’s all opinionated.

Well you can compare components of them but really when someone tells me that PS3 is better than Xbox because it has better graphics I really have to ask. “WHAT THE FUCK IS WRONG WITH YOU!”. I don’t see how people can care about graphics that much. For me it’s all about gameplay, well the games that I play. I don’t give a crap what console it is and what’d be best would be is all the console makers could just stop this lil fued they have going and just release every game on each of there consoles. They should work together to improve console performance, graphics and gameplay, that way they can make gaming better for their consumers and earn more money as a monopoly/duopoly.

so you’d play a game with horrible graphics but a good gameplay?
[/quote]

None of the really good games have good graphics, or at least not for long. Good graphics come and go, but awesome games are awesome forever. I will use the oldest one in the book for an example. The original Doom. If you remember when it came out, it had the most amazing graphics that existed, it looked real to me. Now it looks like 2d graphics and everything is square and pixelated, yet it is still fun as hell to play.[/quote]
007 Goldeneye, one of the best N64 games ever. I remember playing when I was younger and remember how realistic it was (now it’s not), but I still love it (it was my first FPS).

Read full topic

There’s more than just the overall to take into account. As a matter of fact, it’s not even right to judge the system’s overall as a way to choose which is better. There are different qualities in each of them. They’re all relative.

PS3 - Quality
Xbox360 - Quantity (Bigger userbase)
Nintendo - Dynamic

If anyone wants to claim that they have factual information on which is better, they’re wrong before they even start making the post. It’s all opinionated.

Well you can compare components of them but really when someone tells me that PS3 is better than Xbox because it has better graphics I really have to ask. “WHAT THE FUCK IS WRONG WITH YOU!”. I don’t see how people can care about graphics that much. For me it’s all about gameplay, well the games that I play. I don’t give a crap what console it is and what’d be best would be is all the console makers could just stop this lil fued they have going and just release every game on each of there consoles. They should work together to improve console performance, graphics and gameplay, that way they can make gaming better for their consumers and earn more money as a monopoly/duopoly.
[/quote]

so you’d play a game with horrible graphics but a good gameplay?[/quote]

None of the really good games have good graphics, or at least not for long. Good graphics come and go, but awesome games are awesome forever. I will use the oldest one in the book for an example. The original Doom. If you remember when it came out, it had the most amazing graphics that existed, it looked real to me. Now it looks like 2d graphics and everything is square and pixelated, yet it is still fun as hell to play.

item.title: Best Gaming System
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Lil Goon:

Xbox has wireless but it cost $99

Plus another $50 or so for XBL.

Lil Goon:

Ps3 controllers don’t even have rumble packs

http://www.amazon.co.uk/DualShock-3-PS3-controller/dp/B00167U0HY

Lil Goon:

The PSN sucks ass

It works fine and it’s free, the only thing XBL is really good at is bells and whistles.

Lil Goon:

There taking blu ray out of ps3.

If you’re going to spout bullshit rumors then at least use believable ones, if blueray was removed then no current PS3 game would work on this “new” PS3, and a lot of existing games would require several dvd discs(and not 2 or 3, I’m talking 5+, see this).

Also, see cooper’s post.

Lil Goon:

Xbox fixed the over heating and the people that had xbox’s from when they overheated get fixed for free.

What about the people that actually had to pay for it, and are still having consoles breaking? If Microsoft are going to get brownie points for “fixing” it, they should have recalled all consoles affected.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Gaming System
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Square, post:133, topic:264476”]it was 16 - 32 bit.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Nintendo_Entertainment_System#32-bit_era_and_beyond

http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m0EIN/is_1994_Dec_12/ai_15970364/
There’s your DK statistics, and they’re on the wiki as well.[/quote]

While other companies were moving on to 32-bit systems, Rare and Nintendo proved that the Super NES was still a strong contender in the market. In November 1994, Rare released Donkey Kong Country, a platform game featuring 3D models and textures pre-rendered on SGI workstations. With its detailed graphics and high-quality music, Donkey Kong Country rivaled the aesthetic quality of games that were being released on newer 32-bit CD-based consoles.
It is 16, but it competed with 32. And I'm not questioning that it was the fastest selling game at the time, I'm questioning if it still is - an article from 1994 doesn't help :P

Read full topic

i didn’t pay for an investment…[/quote]

item.title: Best Gaming System
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:130, topic:264476”]The PS3’s hardware is better and I feel it has more potential in the long run.

Xbox has wireless but it cost $99, Ps3 controllers don’t even have rumble packs, The PSN sucks ass, There taking blu ray out of ps3. Xbox fixed the over heating and the people that had xbox’s from when they overheated get fixed for free.

-I didn’t pay $99 for wireless, as it’s free on PS3.
-Who cares about rumble (not me, my subwoofer rumbles my house enough) + dual shock 3 does have rumble btw…
-Whats wrong with PSN seriously? The playstation store is great, the web browser is nice to have as well. I can download HD porn movies directly with my ps3 onto the hard drive and watch them on the home theatre system (Just an example, I’ve never done it :|)
-I didn’t know that they were removing blue-ray, but it doesn’t concern me since mine does have it. Everyone should buy it quick imo.
-My friends xbox screwed up twice in last few months, once was just like a week and a half ago and he has to pay $60.00. I don’t know how Sony deals with it atm because playstation 3’s don’t break all the time, but I remember with my ps2 they repaired it twice for me when it was accidents both times and with a void warrenty. I doubt they are that good anymore though.[/quote]
this man is sexy! also when your PS3 breaks sony will normally send you another one and take your one away and replace a disc if it gets stuck inside. When mine broke it was out of warranty but i still got it done for free and with an extra 6 months warranty on top of tthat

Read full topic

item.title: Best Gaming System
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Lil Goon:

Xbox has wireless but it cost $99, Ps3 controllers don’t even have rumble packs, The PSN sucks ass, There taking blu ray out of ps3. Xbox fixed the over heating and the people that had xbox’s from when they overheated get fixed for free.

As jme stated, dualshock 3 [now comes default with ps3s] have “rumble packs”.
Why would they take blu ray out of the ps3? That’d be a very stupid move…
For proof that they’re not, this is from an interview with the SCE CEO Kaz Hirai last wednesday:

Will the PS3 go download only? Let's say we took out the drive so PS3 is network only. What happens when Kojima-san comes out with a new Metal Gear Solid game? Do consumers want to wait for a 50GB download? I think they would rather go the store and pick up a copy. The file sizes for a HD PS3 game are much heavier than a PSP game. Conceptually it may make sense to remove the Blu-Ray drive but in reality it doesn't make sense. Also we never want to be in the position where countries without super fast broadband connections are locked out of the Playstation business because the PS3 has gone download only.
Also, from [url=http://www.joystiq.com/2009/03/12/sony-blu-ray-will-always-be-part-of-ps3/]Joystiq[/url],
That would pretty much destroy the PS3's backbone, our games were built on Blu-ray. Quote that: Blu-ray will always be part of PS3.
Afaik, every ps3 game I own is on blu-ray. My ps3 is fully covered for basically everything - free repair - but that might be from the retailer. However, it's always ran fine. And how does PSN "suck ass"? Free multiplayer gaming? Oh boy, that really sucks, what a shitty deal, xbox live is WAY better...

[quote=“Square, post:131, topic:264476”]SNES all the way.

[ul][li]32-bits of amazing[/li]
[li]Marios[/li]
[li]Donkey Kong Sold 6.1million units in 45 days. (Fastest selling game to this day)[/li][/ul][/quote]
Snes was 16-bit and imo Marios were best on the NES
I’m guessing you got the Donkey Kong quote from wikipedia? If so, you misread:

In the last 45 days of 1994, the game sold 6.1 million units, making it the fastest-selling video game in history to [b]that[/b] date

Read full topic

item.title: Best Gaming System
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

The PS3’s hardware is better and I feel it has more potential in the long run.

Lil Goon:

Xbox has wireless but it cost $99, Ps3 controllers don’t even have rumble packs, The PSN sucks ass, There taking blu ray out of ps3. Xbox fixed the over heating and the people that had xbox’s from when they overheated get fixed for free.

-I didn’t pay $99 for wireless, as it’s free on PS3.
-Who cares about rumble (not me, my subwoofer rumbles my house enough) + dual shock 3 does have rumble btw…
-Whats wrong with PSN seriously? The playstation store is great, the web browser is nice to have as well. I can download HD porn movies directly with my ps3 onto the hard drive and watch them on the home theatre system (Just an example, I’ve never done it :|)
-I didn’t know that they were removing blue-ray, but it doesn’t concern me since mine does have it. Everyone should buy it quick imo.
-My friends xbox screwed up twice in last few months, once was just like a week and a half ago and he has to pay $60.00. I don’t know how Sony deals with it atm because playstation 3’s don’t break all the time, but I remember with my ps2 they repaired it twice for me when it was accidents both times and with a void warrenty. I doubt they are that good anymore though.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Gaming System
item.dc:creator: @Lil_Goon Lil Goon
item.description:
@Lil_Goon wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:39, topic:264476”]Best of all time: N64
Best in innovation (funnest for me): Wii
Best for hard-core gaming: PC
Best of the options in this thread: PS3

The PS3 is better because of quite a few things:

[ul][li]Better hardware, it is faster and most of all won’t overheat and break down every few months[/li]
[li]Plays Blu-ray discs[/li]
[li]Free online play, paying to play online a game that I bought is stupid as hell[/li]
[li]HDMI and 1000/baseT network, I don’t think xboxs have both of these, not all of them anyway[/li]
[li]Can also use as a computer by installing linux on it[/li]
[li]PS3 Controller is superior[/li]
[li]PS3 has built in wireless b/g/n, while xbox has… no wireless at all?[/li][/ul]

Did I miss anything?[/quote]
PS3:
Processor Type: IBM Cell 3.2 GHz
Installed RAM: 256 MB XDR RAM
Optical Drive Type: Blu-ray/DVD/CD
Graphic Processor: NVIDIA RSX
Video Memory: 256MB GDDR3
Max. Resolution: 1920 x 1080
Component Video Support: Yes
Ethernet: 10BASE-T, 100BASE-TX, 1000BASE-T

X360:
Processor Type: 3.2 GHz Triple Core IBM PowerPC
Installed RAM: 512 MB GDDR3 SDRAM
Optical Drive Type: DVD-ROM 12x - Tray
Graphic Processor: ATI Xbox 360 - 256-bit - graphics acceleration
Video Memory: 10 MB
Max. Resolution: 1920 x 1080
Component Video Support: Yes

Xbox has wireless but it cost $99, Ps3 controllers don’t even have rumble packs, The PSN sucks ass, There taking blu ray out of ps3. Xbox fixed the over heating and the people that had xbox’s from when they overheated get fixed for free.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Gaming System
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Gloab_, post:122, topic:264476”][quote author=wayzey link=topic=349225.msg2806022#msg2806022 date=1243729417]

There’s more than just the overall to take into account. As a matter of fact, it’s not even right to judge the system’s overall as a way to choose which is better. There are different qualities in each of them. They’re all relative.

PS3 - Quality
Xbox360 - Quantity (Bigger userbase)
Nintendo - Dynamic

If anyone wants to claim that they have factual information on which is better, they’re wrong before they even start making the post. It’s all opinionated.

Well you can compare components of them but really when someone tells me that PS3 is better than Xbox because it has better graphics I really have to ask. “WHAT THE FUCK IS WRONG WITH YOU!”. I don’t see how people can care about graphics that much. For me it’s all about gameplay, well the games that I play. I don’t give a crap what console it is and what’d be best would be is all the console makers could just stop this lil fued they have going and just release every game on each of there consoles. They should work together to improve console performance, graphics and gameplay, that way they can make gaming better for their consumers and earn more money as a monopoly/duopoly.
[/quote]

so you’d play a game with horrible graphics but a good gameplay?[/quote]
I’m guessing you’ve never played any MUDs

Read full topic

I don’t see how people can care about graphics that much. For me it’s all about gameplay, well the games that I play. I don’t give a crap what console it is and what’d be best would be is all the console makers could just stop this lil fued they have going and just release every game on each of there consoles. They should work together to improve console performance, graphics and gameplay, that way they can make gaming better for their consumers and earn more money as a monopoly/duopoly.

so you’d play a game with horrible graphics but a good gameplay?
[/quote]

That pretty much describes all of the best games ever made…[/quote]
lies, Oblivion is epic and graphics are sexy as fuck
